sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"破坏，损坏"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: break, destroy, ruin, wreck, damage, spoil
means: break ： 普通用词，指某物因被打破或撕破而受到破坏，可指有形或无形的破坏。
destroy ： 多指彻底地、毁灭性地破坏，含导致无用，不能或很难再修复的意味。
ruin ： 多指因外部原因而受到严重破坏或毁灭，侧重破坏的彻底性，也可用于引申意义。
wreck ： 侧重指船只、车辆、房屋等受到严重破坏或完全毁坏，也可指计划、健康受到损害。
damage ： 多指对无生命物体的损害，造成降低价值、破坏功能等后果。
spoil ： 强调不仅会削弱力量、精力或价值，而且会导致不可避免的毁灭。

sentence.Network_en: She wasn't going to let her plans go to ruin.
sentence.Network_cn: 她不会让她的计划破产的。

sentence.Network_en: "But we might ruin the stove." — "Who cares?"
sentence.Network_cn: “可我们会把炉子弄坏的!”——“我才不在乎呢！”

sentence.Network_en: We looked out upon a scene of desolation and ruin.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们放眼望去，眼前是一片荒凉的废墟。

jx.jx_en_mean: in a state of complete disorder or disintegration
jx.jx_cn_mean: 被毁灭的；毁坏了的；垮掉的；成废墟的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'collapse of a building'): from Old French ruine, from Latin ruina, from ruere 'to fall'

entry.def: To ruin something means to severely harm, damage, or spoil it.

example.ex: My wife was ruining her health through worry...
example.tran: 忧虑严重损害了我妻子的健康。

example.ex: Entire villages have been washed away. Roads and bridges have been destroyed and crops ruined.
example.tran: 这些村庄全部都被冲走了。道路和桥梁都被破坏了，农作物也全毁了。

entry.def: To ruin someone means to cause them to no longer have any money.

example.ex: She accused him of ruining her financially with his taste for the high life.
example.tran: 她指责他为了追求奢华的生活致使她倾家荡产。

entry.def: Ruin is the state of no longer having any money.

example.ex: The farmers say recent inflation has driven them to the brink of ruin.
example.tran: 农民们说最近的通货膨胀使他们濒临破产。

entry.def: Ruin is the state of being severely damaged or spoiled, or the process of reaching this state.

example.ex: The vineyards were falling into ruin...
She wasn't going to let her plans go to ruin.
example.tran: 她不会让她的计划破产的。

entry.def: The ruins of something are the parts of it that remain after it has been severely damaged or weakened.

example.ex: The new Turkish republic he helped to build emerged from the ruins of a great empire...
example.tran: 他帮助建立起的新土耳其共和国是从一个伟大帝国的废墟上发展起来的。

example.ex: He stood very still, staring in at the ruins of his work.
example.tran: 他站在那里一动也不动，呆呆地看着他残余的作品。

entry.def: The ruins of a building are the parts of it that remain after the rest has fallen down or been destroyed.

example.ex: One dead child was found in the ruins almost two hours after the explosion...
example.tran: 爆炸发生将近两个小时以后，在废墟中发现了一个已经死亡的小孩。

example.ex: There's only the mountain in this direction, and higher up an old ruin, an abandoned castle.
example.tran: 从这个方向望去只看得到这座山，以及更高处的一处废墟，一座废弃的城堡。

entry.tran: 完全崩溃;垮掉;破败不堪
entry.def: If something is in ruins, it is completely spoiled.

example.ex: Its heavily-subsidized economy is in ruins...
example.tran: 其靠资助维持的经济已经完全崩溃了。

example.ex: This country was once proud of its education system. Now it seems to be in ruins.
example.tran: 这个国家曾一度为其教育体系感到自豪。但现在它似乎已经千疮百孔了。

entry.def: If a building or place is in ruins, most of it has been destroyed and only parts of it remain.

example.tran: 这个修道院已经成了一片废墟。

example.ex: Within Germany, the city of Berlin lay in ruins.
example.tran: 在德国，柏林市已经满目疮痍。

means.word_mean: 1. an irrecoverable state of devastation and destruction;

sentences.sentence: "you have brought ruin on this entire family"

means.word_mean: 4. an event that results in destruction
5. failure that results in a loss of position or reputation

sentences.sentence: "You have ruined my car by pouring sugar in the tank!"
"This behavior will ruin your chances of winning the election"
"My daughter's fancy wedding is going to break me!"
"The slump in the financial markets smashed him"
"The country lay ruined after the war"
"This dirty old man deflowered several young girls in the village"

auth_sentence.res_content: Decades later, it was still mostly a ruin.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Decades later, it was still mostly a ruin.

auth_sentence.content: A most noble ruin...full of beautiful and romantic bits.
auth_sentence.res_content: A most noble ruin...full of beautiful and romantic bits.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A most noble ruin...full of beautiful and romantic bits.

auth_sentence.res_content: An archaeologist inspecting a shard at some prehistoric ruin.

Sentence.sentence: Anyway, there is a little more to tell, but I don't want to ruin the story for you.
The consequences of getting caught are serious and may include a "O" on a test or assignment, an "F" in the class, suspension (暂令停学) or dismissal from school and a ruined reputation.
It will ruin the written language.

Civilization,then,is fine — people banging away on their smartphones are fluently using a code separate from the one they use in actual writing, and there is no evidence that texting is ruining composition skills.
After last week's announcement that Phil Collins might give up touring because live concerts are ruining his voice, doctors are counseling stars about the dos and don'ts of voice care.

sentences.cn: 暴风雨毁坏了我们的小麦。

sentences.en: I was ruined by that law case, I'm a ruined man.
sentences.cn: 我被那场官司搞垮了, 现在已经倾家荡产。

means.word_mean: 毁坏, 毁灭, 灭亡

sentences.en: This news meant the ruin of all our hopes.
sentences.cn: 这消息使我们的一切希望都破灭了。

means.word_mean: 破产（或丢掉工作等）的根源；祸根

sentences.en: This flood will be the ruin of the harvest.
sentences.cn: 这场洪水将是没有收成的祸根。

means.word_mean: 破败、坍塌或毁坏的状态

sentences.en: The church has fallen into ruin.
The abbey is now a ruin.
sentences.cn: 那座修道院现已成废墟。

sentences.en: Many ruins of Roman date are to be seen in the south of France.
sentences.cn: 许多古罗马时期的遗迹可以在法国南部看到。

jushi.english: The town ruined after the bombing.
jushi.chinese: 那次轰炸后,这个市镇变成了一片废墟。

jushi.english: She has a very real grievance against the hospital since the operation which ruined her health.
jushi.chinese: 自从她做过手术后,健康状况变坏,所以她确实对医院有怨言。
